open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem sequential_characterization_of_limit
    {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [FirstCountableTopology X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
    {f : X â†’ Y} {D_f : Set X} {hat_u : X} {hat_v : Y}
    (_h_hat_u_in_closure : hat_u âˆˆ closure D_f) :
    (Tendsto f (ğ“[D_f] hat_u) (ğ“ hat_v)) â†”
    (âˆ€ u : â„• â†’ X, (âˆ€ n, u n âˆˆ D_f) â†’ Tendsto u atTop (ğ“ hat_u) â†’ Tendsto (f âˆ˜ u) atTop (ğ“ hat_v)) := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:

â€¢ $\lim_{u\to \widehat u}f(u)=\widehat v$ [def_1].
Therefore, we conclude:
â€¢ For any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists a $\delta > 0$ such that for any $u \in D_f$, if $\rho(u, \widehat{u}) < \delta$, then $\sigma(f(u), \widehat{v}) < \epsilon$ [l1].
